quotes.text: Always seek out the seed of triumph in every adversity.
quotes.author: Og Mandino

quotes.text: He who knows, does not speak. He who speaks, does not know.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: Avoid having your ego so close to your position that when your position falls, your ego goes with it.
quotes.author: Colin Powell

quotes.text: They must often change, who would be constant in happiness or wisdom.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: It is impossible to love and to be wise.
quotes.author: Francis Bacon

quotes.text: No party has a monopoly on wisdom. No democracy works without compromise.
quotes.author: Barack Obama

quotes.text: To study and not think is a waste. To think and not study is dangerous.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: These days people seek knowledge, not wisdom. Knowledge is of the past; wisdom is of the future.
quotes.author: Vernon Cooper

quotes.text: And I love that even in the toughest moments, when we're all sweating it - when we're worried that the bill won't pass, and it seems like all is lost - Barack never lets himself get distracted by the chatter and the noise. Just like his grandmother, he just keeps getting up and moving forward... with patience and wisdom, and courage and grace.
quotes.author: Michelle Obama

quotes.text: Thought is the blossom; language the bud; action the fruit behind it.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Knowledge is of no value unless you put it into practice.
quotes.author: Anton Chekhov

quotes.text: The most certain sign of wisdom is cheerfulness.
quotes.author: Michel de Montaigne

quotes.text: If you only have a hammer, you tend to see every problem as a nail.
quotes.author: Abraham Maslow

quotes.text: Study the past, if you would divine the future.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: We don't receive wisdom; we must discover it for ourselves after a journey that no one can take for us or spare us.
quotes.author: Marcel Proust

quotes.text: Grief can be the garden of compassion. If you keep your heart open through everything, your pain can become your greatest ally in your life's search for love and wisdom.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.text: The young man knows the rules, but the old man knows the exceptions.
quotes.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

quotes.text: Start with what is right rather than what is acceptable.
quotes.author: Franz Kafka

quotes.text: Where there is charity and wisdom, there is neither fear nor ignorance.
quotes.author: Francis of Assisi

quotes.text: Everyone in the world ought to do the things for which he is specially adapted. It is the part of wisdom to recognize what each one of us is best fitted for, and it is the part of education to perfect and utilize such predispositions. Because education can direct and aid nature but can never transform her.
quotes.author: Maria Montessori

quotes.text: Make it your habit not to be critical about small things.
quotes.author: Edward Everett Hale

quotes.text: To keep your secret is wisdom; but to expect others to keep it is folly.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.text: As an elephant in the battlefield withstands arrows shot from bows all around, even so shall I endure abuse.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Silence at the proper season is wisdom, and better than any speech.
quotes.author: Plutarch

quotes.text: I will not be concerned at other men's not knowing me; I will be concerned at my own want of ability.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: The superior man is satisfied and composed; the mean man is always full of distress.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: The sum of wisdom is that time is never lost that is devoted to work.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Do not scorn what you have received, nor envy the gains of others. He who envies others does not obtain peace of mind.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: He is no fool who gives what he cannot keep to gain what he cannot lose.
quotes.author: Jim Elliot

quotes.text: Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Nature and books belong to the eyes that see them.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Begin, be bold, and venture to be wise.
quotes.author: Horace

quotes.text: To have much learning and skill, to be well-trained in discipline, and good in speech — this is the highest blessing.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Meditation brings wisdom, lack of meditation leaves ignorance. Know well what leads you forward and what holds you back and choose the path that leads to wisdom.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
quotes.author: Isocrates

quotes.text: The greatest obstacle to discovery is not ignorance - it is the illusion of knowledge.
quotes.author: Daniel J. Boorstin

quotes.text: Our greatness lies not so much in being able to remake the world as being able to remake ourselves.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: Great indeed is the sublimity of the Creative, to which all beings owe their beginning, and which permeates all heaven.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: Ignorant men raise questions that wise men answered a thousand years ago.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.text: Change will not come if we wait for some other person or some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek.
quotes.author: Barack Obama

quotes.text: Applause is a receipt, not a bill.
quotes.author: Dale Carnegie

quotes.text: Never accept ultimatums, conventional wisdom, or absolutes.
quotes.author: Christopher Reeve

quotes.text: There is a wisdom of the head, and a wisdom of the heart.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.text: Without courage, wisdom bears no fruit.
quotes.author: Baltasar Gracián

quotes.text: Sincerity is the way of Heaven. The attainment of sincerity is the way of men.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: An ant on the move does more than a dozing ox
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: Commitment is an act, not a word.
quotes.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quotes.text: Wisdom has its root in goodness, not goodness its root in wisdom.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Wisdom begins in wonder.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.text: Cleverness is not wisdom.
quotes.author: Euripides

quotes.text: It requires wisdom to understand wisdom: the music is nothing if the audience is deaf.
quotes.author: Walter Lippmann

quotes.text: With age comes wisdom and a high sex drive. And the wisdom to enjoy it.
quotes.author: Amber Valletta

quotes.text: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens.
quotes.author: Jimi Hendrix

quotes.text: Wisdom comes alone through suffering.
quotes.author: Aeschylus

quotes.text: Wisdom begins at the end.
quotes.author: Daniel Webster

quotes.text: Kindness is more important than wisdom, and the recognition of this is the beginning of wisdom.
quotes.author: Theodore Isaac Rubin

quotes.text: Pure, holy simplicity confounds all the wisdom of this world and the wisdom of the flesh.
quotes.author: Francis of Assisi

quotes.text: Patience is the companion of wisdom.
quotes.author: Augustine of Hippo

quotes.text: Wisdom is found only in truth.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.text: Not engaging in ignorance is wisdom.
quotes.author: Bodhidharma

quotes.text: Wisdom is the supreme part of happiness.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Wisdom consists of the anticipation of consequences.
quotes.author: Norman Cousins

quotes.text: Much wisdom often goes with fewer words.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: Wisdom is always an overmatch for strength.
quotes.author: Phil Jackson

quotes.text: The doors of wisdom are never shut.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: Memory is the mother of all wisdom.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.text: A short saying often contains much wisdom.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: All wisdom does not reside in Delhi.
quotes.author: P. Chidambaram

quotes.text: Much wisdom often goes with fewest words.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: The truest wisdom is a resolute determination.
quotes.author: Napoleon

quotes.text: Silence is the sleep that nourishes wisdom.
quotes.author: Francis Bacon

quotes.text: Good people are good because they've come to wisdom through failure. We get very little wisdom from success, you know.
quotes.author: William Saroyan

quotes.text: Along with success comes a reputation for wisdom.
quotes.author: Euripides

quotes.text: Wisdom alone is the science of other sciences.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.text: Cunning... is but the low mimic of wisdom.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.text: A prudent question is one half of wisdom.
quotes.author: Francis Bacon

quotes.text: To conquer fear is the beginning of wisdom.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.text: Knowing others is wisdom, knowing yourself is Enlightenment.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: Nine-tenths of wisdom is being wise in time.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.text: The pine stays green in winter... wisdom in hardship.
quotes.author: Norman Douglas

quotes.text: Wisdom has never made a bigot, but learning has.
quotes.author: Josh Billings

quotes.text: Logic is the beginning of wisdom, not the end.
quotes.author: Leonard Nimoy

quotes.text: Mistakes are the usual bridge between inexperience and wisdom.
quotes.author: Phyllis Grissim-Theroux

quotes.text: A poem begins in delight and ends in wisdom.
quotes.author: Robert Frost

quotes.text: Many sophisticated, intelligent people lack wisdom and common sense.
quotes.author: Joyce Meyer

quotes.text: Wisdom ceases to be wisdom when it becomes too proud to weep, too grave to laugh, and too selfish to seek other than itself.
quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.text: Vanity can easily overtake wisdom. It usually overtakes common sense.
quotes.author: Julian Casablancas

quotes.text: What wisdom can you find that is greater than kindness?
quotes.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quotes.text: Wisdom often times consists of knowing what to do next.
quotes.author: Herbert Hoover

quotes.text: It is good even for old men to learn wisdom.
quotes.author: Aeschylus

quotes.text: Imagination is more important than knowledge. For while knowledge defines all we currently know and understand, imagination points to all we might yet discover and create.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: Think big thoughts but relish small pleasures.
quotes.author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

quotes.text: Irony is the gaiety of reflection and the joy of wisdom.
quotes.author: Anatole France

quotes.text: When in doubt, don't.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: He who knows that enough is enough will always have enough.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: 'All conditioned things are impermanent' — when one sees this with wisdom, one turns away from suffering.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: You can stand tall without standing on someone. You can be a victor without having victims.
quotes.author: Harriet Woods

quotes.text: The way you see people is the way you treat them, and the way you treat them is what they become.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.text: Injuries may be forgiven, but not forgotten.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.text: All experiences are preceded by mind, having mind as their master, created by mind.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Everything you are against weakens you. Everything you are for empowers you.
quotes.author: Wayne Dyer

quotes.text: Let us revere, let us worship, but erect and open-eyed, the highest, not the lowest; the future, not the past!
quotes.author: Charlotte Perkins Gilman

quotes.text: To acquire knowledge, one must study; but to acquire wisdom, one must observe.
quotes.author: Marilyn vos Savant

quotes.text: There is nothing permanent except change.
quotes.author: Heraclitus

quotes.text: All human wisdom is summed up in two words; wait and hope.
quotes.author: Alexandre Dumas

quotes.text: The fall of dropping water wears away the Stone.
quotes.author: Lucretius

quotes.text: To make no mistakes is not in the power of man; but from their errors and mistakes the wise and good learn wisdom for the future.
quotes.author: Plutarch

quotes.text: That old law about 'an eye for an eye' leaves everybody blind. The time is always right to do the right thing.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.text: What makes Superman a hero is not that he has power, but that he has the wisdom and the maturity to use the power wisely. From an acting point of view, that's how I approached the part.
quotes.author: Christopher Reeve

quotes.text: Irrigators channel waters; fletchers straighten arrows; carpenters bend wood; the wise master themselves.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Those who cannot learn from history are doomed to repeat it.
quotes.author: George Santayana

quotes.text: The greater our knowledge increases the more our ignorance unfolds.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.text: Just as a mother would protect her only child with her life, even so let one cultivate a boundless love towards all beings.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
quotes.author: Norman Vincent Peale

quotes.text: Things do not change; we change.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.text: You should ignore that person’s impure behavior by way of speech and body, and focus on the fact that they get an openness and clarity of heart from time to time. That’s how to get rid of resentment for that person.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: It is the province of knowledge to speak, and it is the privilege of wisdom to listen.
quotes.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

quotes.text: To wear your heart on your sleeve isn't a very good plan; you should wear it inside, where it functions best.
quotes.author: Margaret Thatcher

quotes.text: You can fool all the people some of the time, and some of the people all the time, but you cannot fool all the people all the time.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: Imagination is the highest kite one can fly.
quotes.author: Lauren Bacall

quotes.text: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
quotes.author: George Eliot

quotes.text: The more sand that has escaped from the hourglass of our life, the clearer we should see through it.
quotes.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quotes.text: Character is like a tree and reputation like a shadow. The shadow is what we think of it; the tree is the real thing.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: A mind unruffled by the vagaries of fortune, from sorrow freed, from defilements cleansed, from fear liberated — this is the greatest blessing.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Do not give your attention to what others do or fail to do; give it to what you do or fail to do.
quotes.author: Dhammapada

quotes.text: Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment.
quotes.author: Jim Rohn

quotes.text: Honesty is the best policy.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: Argue for your limitations, and sure enough they're yours.
quotes.author: Richard Bach

quotes.text: It is the supreme art of the teacher to awaken joy in creative expression and knowledge.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: We don't know a millionth of one percent about anything.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison

quotes.text: Imagination is more important than knowledge...
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: A little knowledge that acts is worth infinitely more than much knowledge that is idle.
quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.text: Knowledge is going to make you stronger. Knowledge is going to let you control your life. Knowledge is going to give you the wisdom to teach their children. Knowledge is the thing that makes you smile in the face of disaster.
quotes.author: Avery Brooks

quotes.text: Wisdom is a kind of knowledge. It is knowledge of the nature, career, and consequences of human values.
quotes.author: Sidney Hook

quotes.text: Sorrow is knowledge, those that know the most must mourn the deepest, the tree of knowledge is not the tree of life.
quotes.author: Lord Byron

quotes.text: All our knowledge has its origins in our perceptions.
quotes.author: Leonardo da Vinci

quotes.text: True knowledge exists in knowing that you know nothing.
quotes.author: Isocrates

quotes.text: Knowledge rests not upon truth alone, but upon error also.
quotes.author: Carl Jung

quotes.text: Beware of false knowledge; it is more dangerous than ignorance.
quotes.author: Bernard Shaw

quotes.text: If you have knowledge, let others light their candles in it.
quotes.author: Margaret Fuller

quotes.text: A good decision is based on knowledge and not on numbers.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.text: Science gives us knowledge, but only philosophy can give us wisdom.
quotes.author: Will Durant

quotes.text: Knowledge without justice ought to be called cunning rather than wisdom.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.text: The beginning of knowledge is the discovery of something we do not understand.
quotes.author: Frank Herbert

quotes.text: True friendship can afford true knowledge. It does not depend on darkness and ignorance.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.text: The doorstep to the temple of wisdom is a knowledge of our own ignorance.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: Wisdom is the power to put our time and our knowledge to the proper use.
quotes.author: Thomas J. Watson

quotes.text: In friendship as well as love, ignorance very often contributes more to our happiness than knowledge.
quotes.author: François de La Rochefoucauld

quotes.text: Knowledge is proud that it knows so much; wisdom is humble that it knows no more.
quotes.author: William Cowper

quotes.text: The superior man understands what is right; the inferior man understands what will sell.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: To be wronged is nothing unless you continue to remember it.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: Wisdom, compassion, and courage are the three universally recognized moral qualities of men.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: If you look into your own heart, and you find nothing wrong there, what is there to worry about? What is there to fear?
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: Wherever you go, go with all your heart.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: When you see a good person, think of becoming like him. When you see someone not so good, reflect on your own weak points.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: The cautious seldom err.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: He who wishes to secure the good of others, has already secured his own.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: I hear and I forget. I see and I remember. I do and I understand.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: Learning without reflection is a waste, reflection without learning is dangerous.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: I want you to be everything that's you, deep at the center of your being.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: Being in humaneness is good. If we select other goodness and thus are far apart from humaneness, how can we be the wise?
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: When it is obvious that the goals cannot be reached, don't adjust the goals, adjust the action steps.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: By three methods we may learn wisdom: First, by reflection, which is noblest; Second, by imitation, which is easiest; and third by experience, which is the bitterest.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: Reviewing what you have learned and learning anew, you are fit to be a teacher.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: Some of the best lessons we ever learn are learned from past mistakes. The error of the past is the wisdom and success of the future.
quotes.author: Dale Turner

quotes.text: Give me a lever long enough and a fulcrum on which to place it, and I shall move the world.
quotes.author: Archimedes

quotes.text: A heart well prepared for adversity in bad times hopes, and in good times fears for a change in fortune.
quotes.author: Horace

quotes.text: To profit from good advice requires more wisdom than to give it.
quotes.author: Wilson Mizner

quotes.text: People usually compare the computer to the head of the human being. I would say that hardware is the bone of the head, the skull. The semiconductor is the brain within the head. The software is the wisdom. And data is the knowledge.
quotes.author: Masayoshi Son

quotes.text: Speak only endearing speech, speech that is welcomed. Speech, when it brings no evil to others, is a pleasant thing.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Democracy's premise rests on the notion that the collective wisdom of the majority will prove right more often than it's wrong; that given sufficient opportunity in the pursuit of happiness, your population will develop its talents, its intellect, its better judgment; that over time its capacity for discernment and self-correction will be enlarged.
quotes.author: Ben Fountain

quotes.text: Even if you're on the right track, you'll get run over if you just sit there.
quotes.author: Will Rogers

quotes.text: Excellence, then, is a state concerned with choice, lying in a mean, relative to us, this being determined by reason and in the way in which the man of practical wisdom would determine it.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.text: Delight in heedfulness! Guard well your thoughts!
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Leave no stone unturned.
quotes.author: Euripides

quotes.text: If you don't know where you are going, any road will get you there.
quotes.author: Lewis Carroll

quotes.text: It is in the nature of things that joy arises in a person free from remorse.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: A ruffled mind makes a restless pillow.
quotes.author: Charlotte Brontë

quotes.text: There are three classes of men; lovers of wisdom, lovers of honor, and lovers of gain.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.text: The lure of the distant and the difficult is deceptive. The great opportunity is where you are.
quotes.author: John Burroughs

quotes.text: Work like you don't need the money. Love like you've never been hurt. Dance like nobody's watching.
quotes.author: Satchel Paige

quotes.text: Our shared values define us more than our differences. And acknowledging those shared values can see us through our challenges today if we have the wisdom to trust in them again.
quotes.author: John McCain

quotes.text: Silence is a source of great strength.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: Genius unrefined resembles a flash of lightning, but wisdom is like the sun.
quotes.author: Franz Grillparzer

quotes.text: He who talks more is sooner exhausted.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: Keep me away from the wisdom which does not cry, the philosophy which does not laugh and the greatness which does not bow before children.
quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.text: The superior man is modest in his speech but exceeds in his actions.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: May all beings have happy minds.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Being entirely honest with oneself is a good exercise.
quotes.author: Sigmund Freud

quotes.text: Pick battles big enough to matter, small enough to win.
quotes.author: Jonathan Kozol

quotes.text: Train up a fig tree in the way it should go, and when you are old sit under the shade of it.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.text: Spectacular achievement is always preceded by unspectacular preparation.
quotes.author: Robert Schuller

quotes.text: There are three methods to gaining wisdom. The first is reflection, which is the highest. The second is limitation, which is the easiest. The third is experience, which is the bitterest.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: It's better to be a lion for a day than a sheep all your life.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Kenny

quotes.text: When a thing is done, it's done. Don't look back. Look forward to your next objective.
quotes.author: George Marshall

quotes.text: 'As I am, so are these. As are these, so am I.' Drawing the parallel to yourself, neither kill nor get others to kill.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: There are more quarrels smothered by just shutting your mouth, and holding it shut, than by all the wisdom in the world.
quotes.author: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.text: By nature, man hates change; seldom will he quit his old home till it has actually fallen around his ears.
quotes.author: Thomas Carlyle

quotes.text: The virtue of justice consists in moderation, as regulated by wisdom.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.text: How many cares one loses when one decides not to be something but to be someone.
quotes.author: Coco Chanel

quotes.text: Persuasion is often more effectual than force.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.text: If we are not given the chance to forget, we are also not given the chance to recover our memories, to alter them with time, perspective, and wisdom. Forgetting, we can be ourselves beyond what the past has told us we are; we can evolve. That is the possibility we want from the future.
quotes.author: Caterina Fake

quotes.text: The Superior Man is aware of Righteousness, the inferior man is aware of advantage.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: Wisdom and penetration are the fruit of experience, not the lessons of retirement and leisure. Great necessities call out great virtues.
quotes.author: Abigail Adams

quotes.text: Knowledge is knowing that a tomato is a fruit. Wisdom is knowing not to put it in a fruit salad.
quotes.author: Brian O'Driscoll

quotes.text: What is past is left behind. The future is yet unreached. Whatever quality is present, clearly see it right there.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: In life, all good things come hard, but wisdom is the hardest to come by.
quotes.author: Lucille Ball

quotes.text: The smallest deed is better than the greatest intention.
quotes.author: John Burroughs

quotes.text: I am not bothered by the fact that I am unknown. I am bothered when I do not know others.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: But what is liberty without wisdom, and without virtue? It is the greatest of all possible evils; for it is folly, vice, and madness, without tuition or restraint.
quotes.author: Edmund Burke

quotes.text: If one does not know to which port one is sailing, no wind is favorable.
quotes.author: Seneca the Younger

quotes.text: He who can curb his wrath as soon as it arises, as a timely antidote will check snake's venom that so quickly spreads, — such a monk gives up the here and the beyond, just as a serpent sheds its worn-out skin.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Good judgment comes from experience, and a lot of that comes from bad judgment.
quotes.author: Will Rogers

quotes.text: O, what a tangled web we weave when first we practice to deceive!
quotes.author: Walter Scott

quotes.text: When we are no longer able to change a situation - we are challenged to change ourselves.
quotes.author: Viktor Frankl

quotes.text: I do not dispute with the world; rather it is the world that disputes with me.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: You always have two choices: your commitment versus your fear.
quotes.author: Sammy Davis Jr.

quotes.text: What is necessary to change a person is to change his awareness of himself.
quotes.author: Abraham Maslow

quotes.text: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.text: No man was ever wise by chance.
quotes.author: Seneca the Younger

quotes.text: I hope our wisdom will grow with our power, and teach us, that the less we use our power the greater it will be.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.text: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.text: You can't stop the waves, but you can learn to surf.
quotes.author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

quotes.text: We all grow up. Hopefully, we get wiser. Age brings wisdom, and fatherhood changes one's life completely.
quotes.author: Frank Abagnale

quotes.text: Ceasing to do evil, Cultivating the good, Purifying the heart: This is the teaching of the Buddhas.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: In wisdom gathered over time I have found that every experience is a form of exploration.
quotes.author: Ansel Adams

quotes.text: Resolutely train yourself to attain peace.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Should a person do good, let him do it again and again. Let him find pleasure therein, for blissful is the accumulation of good.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Once you label me you negate me.
quotes.author: Søren Kierkegaard

quotes.text: Those who cling to perceptions and views wander the world offending people.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Ability will never catch up with the demand for it.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: And when the world is created, it is created in such a way that those eternal objects of God's loving wisdom become actualities - interacting with one another, relating to God in the finite realm.
quotes.author: Rowan Williams

quotes.text: Those that know, do. Those that understand, teach.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.text: He that never changes his opinions, never corrects his mistakes, and will never be wiser on the morrow than he is today.
quotes.author: Tryon Edwards

quotes.text: He who knows himself is enlightened.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: I walk slowly, but I never walk backward.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: It has been my experience that folks who have no vices have very few virtues.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: Wisdom is the right use of knowledge. To know is not to be wise. Many men know a great deal and are all the greater fools for it. There is no fool so great a fool as a knowing fool. But to know how to use knowledge is to have wisdom.
quotes.author: Charles Spurgeon

quotes.text: Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Both formerly and now, it is only suffering that I describe, and the cessation of suffering.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: They blame those who remain silent, they blame those who speak much, they blame those who speak in moderation. There is none in the world who is not blamed.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Doing nothing is better than being busy doing nothing.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: Those who are free of resentful thoughts surely find peace.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Talent is God-given; be humble. Fame is man-given; be thankful. Conceit is self-given; be careful.
quotes.author: Harvey Mackay

quotes.text: We respect our elders. There is wisdom that comes from experience, and I am not going to stop learning from wise counsel.
quotes.author: Marcia Fudge

quotes.text: If with a pure mind a person speaks or acts, happiness follows them like a never-departing shadow.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Love is the wisdom of the fool and the folly of the wise.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.text: Some people thrive on huge, dramatic change. Some people prefer the slow and steady route. Do what's right for you.
quotes.author: Julie Morgenstern

quotes.text: Whatever is not yours: let go of it. Your letting go of it will be for your long-term happiness & benefit.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: The opportunity for brotherhood presents itself every time you meet a human being.
quotes.author: Jane Wyman

quotes.text: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: The more you know yourself, the more you forgive yourself.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: Wise men make more opportunities than they find.
quotes.author: Francis Bacon

quotes.text: Purity and impurity depend on oneself; no one can purify another.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: A lie gets halfway around the world before the truth has a chance to get its pants on.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.text: If I am not for myself, who will be for me? If I am not for others, what am I? And if not now, when?
quotes.author: Rabbi Hillel

quotes.text: It's a good thing to be satisfied with what one has.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Sometimes I am happy and sometimes not. I am, after all, a human being, you know. And I am glad that we are sometimes happy and sometimes not. You get your wisdom working by having different emotions.
quotes.author: Yoko Ono

quotes.text: As you walk down the fairway of life you must smell the roses, for you only get to play one round.
quotes.author: Ben Hogan

quotes.text: Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake.
quotes.author: Napoleon

quotes.text: Whatever has the nature of arising has the nature of ceasing.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Much though he recites the sacred texts, but acts not accordingly, that heedless man is like a cowherd who only counts the cows of others
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: The function of wisdom is to discriminate between good and evil.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.text: Wisdom is nothing but a preparation of the soul, a capacity, a secret art of thinking, feeling and breathing thoughts of unity at every moment of life.
quotes.author: Hermann Hesse

quotes.text: The world is afflicted by death and decay. But the wise do not grieve, having realized the nature of the world.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Short words are best and the old words when short are best of all.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.text: America's freedom of religion, and freedom from religion, offers every wisdom tradition an opportunity to address our soul-deep needs: Christianity, Judaism, Islam, Buddhism, Hinduism, secular humanism, agnosticism and atheism among others.
quotes.author: Parker Palmer

quotes.text: At the center of your being, you have the answer; you know who you are, and you know what you want.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: Time changes everything except something within us which is always surprised by change.
quotes.author: Thomas Hardy

quotes.text: Experience is not what happens to you; it's what you do with what happens to you.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.text: The universe is full of magical things, patiently waiting for our wits to grow sharper.
quotes.author: Eden Phillpotts

quotes.text: The invariable mark of wisdom is to see the miraculous in the common.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Know what's important and what isn't. Have the wisdom to know the right thing to do, the integrity to do it, the character to stand up to those who don't, and the courage to stop those who won't.
quotes.author: Mark Goulston

quotes.text: To support mother and father, to cherish partner and children, and to be engaged in peaceful occupation — this is the greatest blessing.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: It's easier to resist at the beginning than at the end.
quotes.author: Leonardo da Vinci

quotes.text: You must welcome change as the rule but not as your ruler.
quotes.author: Denis Waitley

quotes.text: The truest greatness lies in being kind, the truest wisdom in a happy mind.
quotes.author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quotes.text: If you want to go east, don't go west.
quotes.author: Ramakrishna

quotes.text: One should train in deeds of merit—generosity, a balanced life, developing a loving mind—that yield long-lasting happiness.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: We are wiser than we know.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: You can only learn so much from books. You can only learn so much from education. Ultimately, it is the wisdom of God that will carry you through in the toughest situations of life.
quotes.author: Ravi Zacharias

quotes.text: We live in a society bloated with data yet starved for wisdom. We're connected 24/7, yet anxiety, fear, depression and loneliness are at an all-time high. We must course-correct.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Kapu'uwailani Lindsey

quotes.text: Pain and foolishness lead to great bliss and complete knowledge, for Eternal Wisdom created nothing under the sun in vain.
quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.text: You've got to go out on a limb sometimes because that's where the fruit is.
quotes.author: Will Rogers

quotes.text: Give, even if you only have a little.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: We gain the strength of the temptation we resist.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: True wisdom is less presuming than folly. The wise man doubteth often, and changeth his mind; the fool is obstinate, and doubteth not; he knoweth all things but his own ignorance.
quotes.author: Akhenaten

quotes.text: Every adversity, every failure, every heartache carries with it the seed of an equal or greater benefit.
quotes.author: Napoleon Hill

quotes.text: Music is a higher revelation than all wisdom and philosophy.
quotes.author: Ludwig van Beethoven

quotes.text: Until you value yourself, you won't value your time. Until you value your time, you won't do anything with it.
quotes.author: M. Scott Peck

quotes.text: A leader is best when people barely know he exists, when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: A long habit of not thinking a thing wrong gives it a superficial appearance of being right.
quotes.author: Thomas Paine

quotes.text: They say that time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.
quotes.author: Andy Warhol

quotes.text: He who learns must suffer. And even in our sleep pain that cannot forget falls drop by drop upon the heart, and in our own despair, against our will, comes wisdom to us by the awful grace of God.
quotes.author: Aeschylus

quotes.text: Just as a solid rock is not shaken by the storm, even so the wise are not affected by praise or blame.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Talent is God given. Be humble. Fame is man-given. Be grateful. Conceit is self-given. Be careful.
quotes.author: John Wooden

quotes.text: All things must come to the soul from its roots, from where it is planted.
quotes.author: Teresa of Ávila

quotes.text: The difference between what we do and what we are capable of doing would suffice to solve most of the world's problems.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: If you were to offer a thirsty man all wisdom, you would not please him more than if you gave him a drink.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: The greater danger for most of us lies not in setting our aim too high and falling short; but in setting our aim too low and achieving our mark.
quotes.author: Michelangelo

quotes.text: Fears are nothing more than a state of mind.
quotes.author: Napoleon Hill

quotes.text: It is unwise to be too sure of one's own wisdom. It is healthy to be reminded that the strongest might weaken and the wisest might err.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: Conditions fall apart. Persist with diligence.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Know from the rivers in clefts and in crevices: those in small channels flow noisily, the great flow silent. Whatever's not full makes noise. Whatever is full is quiet.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers. It may not be difficult to store up in the mind a vast quantity of facts within a comparatively short time, but the ability to form judgments requires the severe discipline of hard work and the tempering heat of experience and maturity.
quotes.author: Calvin Coolidge

quotes.text: Be sure you put your feet in the right place, then stand firm.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: Life a culmination of the past, an awareness of the present, an indication of the future beyond knowledge, the quality that gives a touch of divinity to matter.
quotes.author: Charles Lindbergh

quotes.text: Wisdom is oftentimes nearer when we stoop than when we soar.
quotes.author: William Wordsworth

quotes.text: You really can change the world if you care enough.
quotes.author: Marian Wright Edelman

quotes.text: To be wrong is nothing unless you continue to remember it.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: I'd rather regret the things I've done than regret the things I haven't done.
quotes.author: Lucille Ball

quotes.text: I look forward to a great future for America - a future in which our country will match its military strength with our moral restraint, its wealth with our wisdom, its power with our purpose.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.text: We will develop and cultivate the liberation of mind by lovingkindness, make it our vehicle, make it our basis, stabilize it, exercise ourselves in it, and fully perfect it.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Wisdom cannot come by railroad or automobile or airplane or be hurried up by telegraph or telephone.
quotes.author: John Burroughs

quotes.text: When written in Chinese, the word 'crisis' is composed of two characters. One represents danger and the other represents opportunity.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.text: Between saying and doing, many a pair of shoes is worn out.
quotes.author: Iris Murdoch

quotes.text: A wise man is superior to any insults which can be put upon him, and the best reply to unseemly behavior is patience and moderation.
quotes.author: Molière

quotes.text: The things that one most wants to do are the things that are probably most worth doing.
quotes.author: Winifred Holtby

quotes.text: The attempt to combine wisdom and power has only rarely been successful and then only for a short while.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: Without freedom of thought, there can be no such thing as wisdom - and no such thing as public liberty without freedom of speech.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: Silence is the true friend that never betrays.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: The final wisdom of life requires not the annulment of incongruity but the achievement of serenity within and above it.
quotes.author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quotes.text: He who is taught to live upon little owes more to his father's wisdom than he who has a great deal left him does to his father's care.
quotes.author: William C. Menninger

quotes.text: Never find fault with the absent.
quotes.author: Alexander Pope

quotes.text: The wise man does not lay up his own treasures. The more he gives to others, the more he has for his own.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: The root of suffering is attachment.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Most of our pocket wisdom is conceived for the use of mediocre people, to discourage them from ambitious attempts, and generally console them in their mediocrity.
quotes.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quotes.text: I prefer the folly of enthusiasm to the indifference of wisdom.
quotes.author: Anatole France

quotes.text: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.text: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: If you are bitter, you are like a dry leaf that you can just squash, and you can get blown away by the wind. There is much more wisdom in forgiveness.
quotes.author: Vusi Mahlasela

quotes.text: There surely is in human nature an inherent propensity to extract all the good out of all the evil.
quotes.author: Benjamin Haydon

quotes.text: One should not hurt others if one loves oneself.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: If the shoe doesn't fit, must we change the foot?
quotes.author: Gloria Steinem

quotes.text: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: Drop by drop is the water pot filled. Likewise, the wise man, gathering it little by little, fills himself with good.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: A tree is known by its fruit; a man by his deeds. A good deed is never lost; he who sows courtesy reaps friendship, and he who plants kindness gathers love.
quotes.author: Basil of Caesarea

quotes.text: There is more wisdom in your body than in your deepest philosophy.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.text: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal.
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.text: Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison

quotes.text: Better than a thousand useless words is one useful word, upon hearing which one attains peace.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: The superior man acts before he speaks, and afterwards speaks according to his action.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: 'As I am, so are they; as they are, so am I.' Comparing others with oneself, do not kill nor cause others to kill.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Never tell people how to do things. Tell them what to do and they will surprise you with their ingenuity.
quotes.author: George S. Patton

quotes.text: A good head and a good heart are always a formidable combination.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.text: Science investigates; religion interprets. Science gives man knowledge which is power; religion gives man wisdom which is control.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.text: Wise kings generally have wise counselors; and he must be a wise man himself who is capable of distinguishing one.
quotes.author: Diogenes

quotes.text: A single lamp may light hundreds of thousands of lamps without itself being diminished.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: Be the chief but never the lord.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: I am not the first Buddha who came upon Earth, nor shall I be the last. In due time, another Buddha will arise in the world - a Holy One, a supremely enlightened One, endowed with wisdom in conduct, auspicious, knowing the universe, an incomparable leader of men, a master of angels and mortals.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Only put off until tomorrow what you are willing to die having left undone.
quotes.author: Pablo Picasso

quotes.text: The day of fortune is like a harvest day, we must be busy when the corn is ripe.
quotes.author: Torquato Tasso

quotes.text: Radiate boundless love towards the entire world…
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: None knows the weight of another's burden.
quotes.author: George Herbert

quotes.text: Better be wise by the misfortunes of others than by your own.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.text: When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everybody will respect you.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: Radiate boundless love towards the entire world — above, below, and across — unhindered, without ill will, without enmity.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: It is with our passions, as it is with fire and water, they are good servants but bad masters.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.text: When watching after yourself, you watch after others. When watching after others, you watch after yourself.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: The power of intuitive understanding will protect you from harm until the end of your days.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: The time to repair the roof is when the sun is shining.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.text: When you meet someone better than yourself, turn your thoughts to becoming his equal. When you meet someone not as good as you are, look within and examine your own self.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: The greatest obstacle to being heroic is the doubt whether one may not be going to prove oneself a fool; the truest heroism is to resist the doubt; and the profoundest wisdom, to know when it ought to be resisted, and when it be obeyed.
quotes.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quotes.text: As you walk in God's divine wisdom, you will surely begin to see a greater measure of victory and good success in your life.
quotes.author: Joseph Prince

quotes.text: We must learn our limits. We are all something, but none of us are everything.
quotes.author: Blaise Pascal

quotes.text: Be as you wish to seem.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.text: If you talk to a man in a language he understands, that goes to his head. If you talk to him in his language, that goes to his heart.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.text: When you realize there is nothing lacking, the whole world belongs to you.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: Conquer anger with non-anger. Conquer badness with goodness. Conquer meanness with generosity. Conquer dishonesty with truth.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Hatred is never appeased by hatred in this world. By non-hatred alone is hatred appeased. This is a law eternal.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Every man is a damn fool for at least five minutes every day; wisdom consists in not exceeding the limit.
quotes.author: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.text: The key to wisdom is this - constant and frequent questioning, for by doubting we are led to question and by questioning we arrive at the truth.
quotes.author: Peter Abelard

quotes.text: All difficult things have their origin in that which is easy, and great things in that which is small.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: Honesty is the first chapter in the book of wisdom.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.text: It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.text: Swim upstream. Go the other way. Ignore the conventional wisdom.
quotes.author: Sam Walton

quotes.text: He who is fixed to a star does not change his mind.
quotes.author: Leonardo da Vinci

quotes.text: It is not wisdom but Authority that makes a law.
quotes.author: Thomas Hobbes

quotes.text: We never understand how little we need in this world until we know the loss of it.
quotes.author: J. M. Barrie

quotes.text: What happens is not as important as how you react to what happens.
quotes.author: Ellen Glasgow

quotes.text: Better it is to live one day seeing the rise and fall of things than to live a hundred years without ever seeing the rise and fall of things.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: He who is contented is rich.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: By oneself is evil done; by oneself is one defiled. By oneself is evil left undone; by oneself is one made pure.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: It is time to remember that old wisdom our soldiers will never forget: that whether we are black or brown or white, we all bleed the same red blood of patriots, we all enjoy the same glorious freedoms, and we all salute the same great American Flag.
quotes.author: Donald Trump

quotes.text: Beware lest you lose the substance by grasping at the shadow.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.text: Your worst enemy cannot harm you as much as your own unguarded thoughts.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: There are three faithful friends - an old wife, an old dog, and ready money.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: Loss is nothing else but change, and change is Nature's delight.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: For beautiful eyes, look for the good in others; for beautiful lips, speak only words of kindness; and for poise, walk with the knowledge that you are never alone.
quotes.author: Audrey Hepburn

quotes.text: He who lives in harmony with himself lives in harmony with the universe.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: I have just three things to teach: simplicity, patience, compassion. These three are your greatest treasures.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: All phenomena are preceded by the mind, created by the mind, and have the mind as their master.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Each day provides its own gifts.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.text: In action a great heart is the chief qualification. In work, a great head.
quotes.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quotes.text: Never reach out your hand unless you're willing to extend an arm.
quotes.author: Pope Paul VI

quotes.text: Forgiveness is choosing to love. It is the first skill of self-giving love.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: Step with care and great tact and remember that Life's a Great Balancing Act.
quotes.author: Dr. Seuss

quotes.text: In dwelling, live close to the ground. In thinking, keep to the simple. In conflict, be fair and generous. In governing, don't try to control. In work, do what you enjoy. In family life, be completely present.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: Imagination allows us to escape the predictable. It enables us to reply to the common wisdom that we cannot soar by saying, 'Just watch!'
quotes.author: Bill Bradley

quotes.text: Of all the things which wisdom provides to make us entirely happy, much the greatest is the possession of friendship.
quotes.author: Epicurus

quotes.text: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.
quotes.author: Isaac Asimov

quotes.text: He who controls others may be powerful, but he who has mastered himself is mightier still.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: The higher we are placed, the more humbly we should walk.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.text: I have always found that mercy bears richer fruits than strict justice.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: There is a difference between happiness and wisdom: he that thinks himself the happiest man is really so; but he that thinks himself the wisest is generally the greatest fool.
quotes.author: Francis Bacon

quotes.text: People don't notice whether it's winter or summer when they're happy.
quotes.author: Anton Chekhov

quotes.text: The thing that is disliked by me is also disliked by others. Since I dislike this thing, how can I inflict it on someone else?
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Anticipate the difficult by managing the easy.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: I think that we have a great opportunity to impart our wisdom and our knowledge and our experience to this younger generation. It may be different times, but experience transcends time, and wisdom transcends time.
quotes.author: Victoria Osteen

quotes.text: Heedfulness is the path to the Deathless. Heedlessness is the path to death. The heedful die not. The heedless are as if already dead.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: The truth is not for all men, but only for those who seek it.
quotes.author: Ayn Rand

quotes.text: If you accept the expectations of others, especially negative ones, then you never will change the outcome.
quotes.author: Michael Jordan

quotes.text: Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: We are masters of the unsaid words, but slaves of those we let slip out.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.text: Before we acquire great power, we must acquire wisdom to use it well.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: When you see a man of worth, think of how you may emulate him. When you see one who is unworthy, examine yourself.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: It is the quality of our work which will please God, not the quantity.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: You are a product of your environment. So choose the environment that will best develop you toward your objective. Analyze your life in terms of its environment. Are the things around you helping you toward success - or are they holding you back?
quotes.author: W. Clement Stone

quotes.text: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: The Universal Zulu Nation stands to acknowledge wisdom, understanding, freedom, justice, and equality, peace, unity, love, and having fun, work, overcoming the negative through the positive, science, mathematics, faith, facts, and the wonders of God, whether we call him Allah, Jehovah, Yahweh, or Jah.
quotes.author: Afrika Bambaataa

quotes.text: We are what our thoughts have made us; so take care about what you think. Words are secondary. Thoughts live; they travel far.
quotes.author: Swami Vivekananda

quotes.text: Should a seeker not find a companion who is better or equal, let them resolutely pursue a solitary course.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: There is no fear for one whose mind is not filled with desires.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: If you change the way you look at things, the things you look at change.
quotes.author: Wayne Dyer

quotes.text: It is easy to be brave from a safe distance.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.text: Great acts are made up of small deeds.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: With pride, there are many curses. With humility, there come many blessings.
quotes.author: Ezra Taft Benson

quotes.text: To lead people walk behind them.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: The superior man blames himself. The inferior man blames others.
quotes.author: Don Shula

quotes.text: Let none find fault with others; let none see the omissions and commissions of others. But let one see one's own acts, done and undone.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Peace cannot be kept by force. It can only be achieved by understanding.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.
quotes.author: Carl Jung

quotes.text: Ideals are an imaginative understanding of that which is desirable in that which is possible.
quotes.author: Walter Lippmann

quotes.text: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to a better understanding of ourselves.
quotes.author: Carl Jung

quotes.text: The key to transforming our hearts and minds is to have an understanding of how our thoughts and emotions work.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.text: All our knowledge begins with the senses, proceeds then to the understanding, and ends with reason. There is nothing higher than reason.
quotes.author: Immanuel Kant

quotes.text: Do not be embarrassed by your mistakes. Nothing can teach us better than our understanding of them. This is one of the best ways of self-education.
quotes.author: Thomas Carlyle

quotes.text: Don't believe what your eyes are telling you. All they show is limitation. Look with your understanding, find out what you already know, and you'll see the way to fly.
quotes.author: Richard Bach

quotes.text: The greatest way to live with honor in this world is to be what we pretend to be.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.text: If you have the guts to keep making mistakes, your wisdom and intelligence leap forward with huge momentum.
quotes.author: Holly Near

quotes.text: All this worldly wisdom was once the unamiable heresy of some wise man.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.text: Music in the soul can be heard by the universe.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: Fear not for the future, weep not for the past.
quotes.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quotes.text: Don’t sacrifice your own welfare for that of another, no matter how great. Realizing your own true welfare, be intent on just that.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: If a man going down into a river, swollen and swiftly flowing, is carried away by the current — how can he help others across? – The Buddha
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: What you do not want done to yourself, do not do to others.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: True wisdom comes to each of us when we realize how little we understand about life, ourselves, and the world around us.
quotes.author: Isocrates

quotes.text: The wisdom of the wise, and the experience of ages, may be preserved by quotation.
quotes.author: Isaac D'Israeli

quotes.text: When you have got an elephant by the hind legs and he is trying to run away, it's best to let him run.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: All things change; nothing perishes.
quotes.author: Ovid

quotes.text: There are many ways of going forward, but only one way of standing still.
quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes.text: I know that inner wisdom is more precious than wealth. The more you spend it, the more you gain.
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.text: Always be a first-rate version of yourself, instead of a second-rate version of somebody else.
quotes.author: Judy Garland

quotes.text: To give oneself earnestly to the duties due to men, and, while respecting spiritual beings, to keep aloof from them, may be called wisdom.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: Nothing is softer or more flexible than water, yet nothing can resist it.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: Our character is what we do when we think no one is looking.
quotes.author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

quotes.text: Do I speak at the right time, or not? Do I speak of facts, or not? Do I speak gently or harshly? Do I speak profitable words or not? Do I speak with a kindly heart, or inwardly malicious?
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: I do not believe in a fate that falls on men however they act; but I do believe in a fate that falls on them unless they act.
quotes.author: G. K. Chesterton

quotes.text: I decided that it was not wisdom that enabled poets to write their poetry, but a kind of instinct or inspiration, such as you find in seers and prophets who deliver all their sublime messages without knowing in the least what they mean.
quotes.author: Isocrates

quotes.text: Always keep an open mind and a compassionate heart.
quotes.author: Phil Jackson

quotes.text: He who knows others is wise. He who knows himself is enlightened.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: The older I get the more wisdom I find in the ancient rule of taking first things first. A process which often reduces the most complex human problem to a manageable proportion.
quotes.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quotes.text: He who conquers others is strong; He who conquers himself is mighty.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach him how to fish and you feed him for a lifetime.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: We are made wise not by the recollection of our past, but by the responsibility for our future.
quotes.author: Bernard Shaw

quotes.text: In complete darkness we are all the same, it is only our knowledge and wisdom that separates us, don't let your eyes deceive you.
quotes.author: Janet Jackson

quotes.text: Ignorance and bungling with love are better than wisdom and skill without.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.text: The road of excess leads to the palace of wisdom.
quotes.author: William Blake

quotes.text: Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: But man is not made for defeat. A man can be destroyed but not defeated.
quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.text: By letting it go it all gets done. The world is won by those who let it go. But when you try and try. The world is beyond the winning.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: Does wisdom perhaps appear on the earth as a raven which is inspired by the smell of carrion?
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.text: To see things in the seed, that is genius.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: It is the neglect of timely repair that makes rebuilding necessary.
quotes.author: Richard Whately

quotes.text: I don't turn to greeting cards for wisdom and advice, but they are a fine reflection of the general drift of the culture.
quotes.author: Susan Orlean

quotes.text: Never interrupt someone doing what you said couldn't be done.
quotes.author: Amelia Earhart

quotes.text: It is the nature of the wise to resist pleasures, but the foolish to be a slave to them.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.text: Adversity has the effect of eliciting talents, which in prosperous circumstances would have lain dormant.
quotes.author: Horace

quotes.text: Whatever you do in life, surround yourself with smart people who'll argue with you.
quotes.author: John Wooden

quotes.text: Should you find a wise critic to point out your faults, follow him as you would a guide to hidden treasure.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: It's the little details that are vital. Little things make big things happen.
quotes.author: John Wooden

quotes.text: The only real valuable thing is intuition.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.text: I will give you a definition of a proud man: he is a man who has neither vanity nor wisdom one filled with hatreds cannot be vain, neither can he be wise.
quotes.author: John Keats

quotes.text: If you do not express your own original ideas, if you do not listen to your own being, you will have betrayed yourself.
quotes.author: Rollo May

quotes.text: The extreme limit of wisdom, that's what the public calls madness.
quotes.author: Jean Cocteau

quotes.text: Appearances are often deceiving.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.text: Don't talk about what you have done or what you are going to do.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.text: The word philosophy sounds high-minded, but it simply means the love of wisdom. If you love something, you don't just read about it; you hug it, you mess with it, you play with it, you argue with it.
quotes.author: Hugh Jackman

quotes.text: The hours of folly are measured by the clock; but of wisdom, no clock can measure.
quotes.author: William Blake

quotes.text: It is a common experience that a problem difficult at night is resolved in the morning after the committee of sleep has worked on it.
quotes.author: John Steinbeck

quotes.text: I never see what has been done; I only see what remains to be done.
quotes.author: Marie Curie

quotes.text: Life is the only real counselor; wisdom unfiltered through personal experience does not become a part of the moral tissue.
quotes.author: Edith Wharton

quotes.text: Quick decisions are unsafe decisions.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.text: All tremble at violence; all fear death. Putting oneself in the place of another, one should not kill nor cause another to kill.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.text: The calmed say that what is well-spoken is best; second, that one should say what is right, not unrighteous; third, what's pleasing, not displeasing; fourth, what is true, not false.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.text: Use what talents you possess; the woods would be very silent if no birds sang there except those that sang best.
quotes.author: Henry van Dyke Jr.

quotes.text: Change in all things is sweet.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.text: A man must be big enough to admit his mistakes, smart enough to profit from them, and strong enough to correct them.
quotes.author: John C. Maxwell

quotes.text: Habit, if not resisted, soon becomes necessity.
quotes.author: Augustine of Hippo

quotes.text: We must become the change we want to see.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: When an opponent comes forward, move in and greet him; if he wants to pull back, send him on his way.
quotes.author: Morihei Ueshiba

quotes.text: There is no instance of a nation benefiting from prolonged warfare.
quotes.author: Sun Tzu
